description: Traces how an author's own prior works serve as conditions of possibility for their current arguments. Classifies each prior work's relationship type (direct precursor, indirect contextualizer, different-field-relevant, counter-position) and adapts analysis accordingly. Detects evolution tactics, conceptual recycling, silent revisions, and other patterns of intellectual self-management. Operates in comprehensive mode (extract all ideas, trace all) or targeted mode (probe specific ideas).

passes.pass_description: Extract main ideas, narratives, and theoretical positions from the current work

Classify each prior work's relationship to the current work (direct precursor, indirect contextualizer, different-field-relevant, counter-position, tangential). Fast classification that determines how Pass 2 analyzes each work. Runs once per prior work.

Scan each prior work for genealogical traces and influences, adapting analysis strategy based on the relationship classification from Pass 1.5. For direct precursors: trace specific ideas. For indirect contextualizers: identify foundational patterns. For different-field works: detect cross-domain transfers. For counter-positions: analyze reversals. Runs once per prior work.
Synthesize evolution of each idea across multiple prior works. Runs once per idea that appears in 2+ prior works.
Analyze rhetorical, analytical, and logical functions of each idea's evolution within the current work
Detect specific evolution tactics used by the author to manage their prior positions
Identify enabling and constraining conditions created by the author's prior work
Generate comprehensive genealogical report synthesizing all findings

output_description: Comprehensive genealogical analysis tracing idea evolution, detecting tactics, and assessing conditions of possibility
